Let me tell you about MORTAR!

So, you know how we build things like houses and castles with blocks, right? Like LEGO blocks?

Well, when we build big things like houses and walls, we use special blocks called "bricks". And to make the bricks stick together, we use a special paste called "mortar".

Mortar is like a strong glue that holds the bricks together. It's made from a mixture of sand, water, and a special powder called "cement". When we mix all these things together, it makes a yummy (not really yummy, but it looks a bit like mud!) paste that we can spread between the bricks.

When the mortar dries, it becomes super strong and holds the bricks together, so they don't fall apart. It's like a big hug for the bricks!

So, that's what mortar is! It's a special helper that makes our buildings strong and safe.

Imagine you have lots of toy boxes, and each toy box has different toys inside. Now, imagine your room is like a big computer.

When you want to play with the toys in a toy box, you need to open it and put it on the floor so you can see and play with the toys. 

In computers, the "toy boxes" are like special containers called "file systems" that have lots of files (or "toys") inside. The computer needs to be able to "see" inside these containers to use the files.

"Mounting" is like putting a toy box on the floor so you can play with it. When you "mount" a file system, you're telling the computer to make it available so it can be used. It's like saying, "Hey, computer! I want to play with the toys in this box! Please put it on the 'floor' (or make it available) so I can use it!"

After you mount it, the computer can see what's inside, and you can use the files. When you're done playing, you can "unmount" it, which is like putting the toy box away, so it's not on the floor anymore.

So, when we say "nip", we're talking about a little pinch or a small bite. It's like when you gently squeeze something between your fingers, or when something tiny bites you (but not too hard!).

Imagine you're playing with a toy, and you gently pinch it between your thumb and finger. That's kind of like a nip! It's a small, gentle squeeze.

Or, if you're outside and a little bug bites you, it might feel like a tiny nip. It's a small, quick pinch that might make you go "Ow!" but it doesn't hurt too much.

So, "nip" is just a word that means a little pinch or a small bite. Does that make sense?

Let me tell you about NUTS!

A nut is a yummy food that grows on trees! Some trees grow special seeds that are hard on the outside and soft on the inside. We call these seeds "nuts".

Imagine a little package with a hard cover, and inside, there's a tasty treat! That's a nut! Some nuts are big, some are small, and they come in different shapes and flavors.

You can eat nuts as a snack, and they're good for you too! Some nuts are crunchy, some are smooth, and they can be eaten all by themselves or used in yummy recipes like cookies and cakes.

Do you like nuts? What's your favorite kind of nut?

Oh boy, are you going to love learning about Panama!

So, you know how we have roads and highways that help us get from one place to another? Like, from your house to the park?

Well, Panama is a special country in Central America that has a really, really important road... but it's not just a road, it's a WATERWAY!

It's called the Panama Canal, and it's like a super-long, super-deep swimming pool for big boats! The canal connects two big oceans: the Pacific Ocean and the Atlantic Ocean.

Imagine you're on a big boat, and you want to get from one ocean to the other. You would have to sail all the way around South America, which is a really, really long way!

But, with the Panama Canal, the boat can just go through the canal, and it will be much, much faster! It's like a shortcut for boats.

So, Panama is a country that has this really cool canal that helps boats travel between two oceans. And that's why it's so important!

Isn't that cool?

So, you know how we eat food to make our tummies happy and give us energy to play?

Well, "pap" is a special kind of food that some people eat, especially when they're feeling a little sick or not very hungry.

Pap is like a soft, mushy porridge made from cornmeal or other grains. It's easy to swallow and gentle on the tummy. Some people like to eat it with a little bit of sugar or milk to make it taste yummy!

Imagine you're feeling a bit under the weather, and your mom or dad makes you a warm, comforting bowl of soft, squishy food. That's kind of what pap is like!

Does that make sense?

Let me tell you about "PALM"!

So, you know how you have hands, right? And on your hands, you have fingers?

Well, the "palm" is the soft, flat part of your hand that is between your fingers and your wrist. It's like the middle part of your hand!

If you look at your hand, you can see that it's a bit curvy and soft, and that's your palm! You can even make a cup shape with your hand by curving your palm.

We use our palms to hold things, like toys or balls, and we can even give high-fives with our palms!

Isn't that cool? Do you have a palm? Let me see!

A 'phone is a special machine that lets you TALK to people who are far, far away!

You can hold it in your hand, and when you press some buttons or touch the screen, it sends your voice to someone else's phone, and they can hear you!

It's like having a magic walkie-talkie, but instead of just talking to someone in the same room, you can talk to grandma who lives in another city, or to daddy who is at work!

You can even see the person you're talking to on the phone, like magic! Some phones can even take pictures and send them to other people's phones.

Isn't that COOL?

Oh boy, let me explain "pique" to you in a super fun way!

So, you know how sometimes you feel a little bit upset or annoyed when something doesn't go the way you want it to? Like, if you're playing with a toy and someone takes it away from you?

That's kind of what "pique" means. It's a feeling of being a little bit irritated or annoyed, but not super angry. It's like a tiny pinch or a small poke that makes you feel a bit grumpy.

For example, if you're playing a game and someone cheats, you might feel a little pique because it's not fair. Or, if you're really looking forward to having ice cream and someone tells you that you can't have it, you might feel a bit pique because you're disappointed.

But, the good news is that "pique" is a feeling that usually goes away quickly. You can take a deep breath, calm down, and feel happy again!

Does that make sense?

Let me tell you about "pile"!

Imagine you have a lot of toys, like blocks or Legos. And you put them all on top of each other, like this:

 Block on the floor
 Another block on top of that one
 Another block on top of that one
 And another one... and another one...

You keep putting blocks on top of each other, and it gets really high! That's a PILE!

It's like a big stack of things, all on top of each other. You can make a pile with toys, books, or even leaves!

Does that make sense?

Let me tell you about "pitcher"!

So, you know how we play baseball? And there's a person who throws the ball to the person who hits it with a bat?

That person who throws the ball is called a "pitcher"! They stand on a special hill called a "mound" and throw the ball to the batter (that's the person with the bat).

Imagine you're playing catch with your friend. You're throwing the ball to them, right? The pitcher is like that, but they're throwing the ball to the batter, and they're trying to throw it in a way that makes it hard for the batter to hit it.

Does that make sense?

A PLANE is a big machine that FLIES in the sky!

Imagine you're playing with a toy airplane, and you throw it across the room. It glides through the air, right?

A real plane is like that, but it's MUCH bigger and it can carry people inside it! It's like a big bus that flies!

When you get on a plane, you sit in a special seat, and it takes you to different places, like to visit grandma or go on a vacation!

The plane has big wings that help it lift off the ground and stay up in the air. And it has engines that make it go "VROOOM!" so it can fly really fast!

Isn't that COOL?

Imagine you're playing a game with your friends, and it's your turn to do something. But, you're not sure what to do yet, or you just want to wait for a little while.

So, you just say "pass"! It means you're not going to do anything right now. You're just going to skip your turn and wait for the next time.

In a game or a puzzle, "pass" is like saying "I'll come back to this later". You're not giving up, you're just waiting for a better time to do it.

Does that make sense?

Oh boy, let me tell you about "poise"!

So, you know how sometimes you might be playing and you trip and fall down? Or maybe you're feeling really excited and you jump up and down? That's okay! We all do that sometimes.

But "poise" is when you're calm and steady, like a superhero standing tall. You're not wobbling around or getting too excited. You're just being strong and steady, like a big, strong tree.

Imagine you're carrying a big cup of juice, and you don't want to spill it. You have to be careful and steady, so you don't trip and make a mess. That's being poised! You're being careful and in control.

It's like being a grown-up, but you can be poised too! You can practice being poised by standing up straight, taking deep breaths, and being careful when you're doing things. And that's super cool!

So, you know how there are rules at home, like "don't touch the stove" and "clean up your toys"? And you know how there are rules at school, like "raise your hand to talk" and "be kind to your friends"?

A "policy" is like a big rule that grown-ups make for a whole group of people, like a school or a company or even a whole country! It's a way to help everyone know what to do and how to behave.

Just like how your parents make rules to help you be safe and happy, grown-ups make policies to help everyone be safe and happy too. And just like how you try to follow the rules at home and at school, people try to follow the policies that the grown-ups make.

For example, a school might have a policy that says "we will keep the playground clean" or "we will be kind to everyone". And a company might have a policy that says "we will be honest with our customers" or "we will help keep the environment clean".

So, policies are like big rules that help everyone know what to do and how to be good to each other!

So, you know how we can touch things with our fingers, right? Like, you can touch a toy or a ball?

Well, "poke" is when you touch something with your finger, but you do it in a gentle way, like you're just giving it a little tap. It's like saying "Hello, I'm here!" to the thing you're touching.

Imagine you have a balloon, and you gently touch it with your finger. That's a poke! You're not pushing it too hard, you're just giving it a little touch.

Or, if you're playing with a friend, you might poke them gently on the arm to get their attention. It's like a little secret way of saying "Hey, look at me!"

Does that make sense?

Let's talk about "pitch"!

You know how we can make different sounds with our voices, like when we sing a happy song or when we say "Oooooh" when we're surprised?

Well, "pitch" is like how high or low those sounds are!

Imagine you're playing with a big slide. When you go "Wheeeee!" as you slide down, your voice is like a slide too!

* If you go "Eeeeee!" really high, that's a HIGH PITCH!
* If you go "Oooooh" really low, like a big rumble, that's a LOW PITCH!

So, pitch is like how high or low your voice is when you make a sound. And we can make our voices go up and down, just like a slide!

Does that make sense?

So, you know how we eat food, like pizza and ice cream? Well, our body uses some of that food to give us energy to play and have fun. But there's some food that our body doesn't need, and that's called... (wait for it)... POOP!

It's like when you throw away a wrapper from a candy you ate. Your body is like, "Okay, I'm done with that food, I'm going to get rid of it!" And it comes out as poop.

It's a natural part of being alive, and everyone makes poop! Even grown-ups! We all go to the bathroom to get rid of it, and then we wash our hands to be clean and healthy.

Isn't that cool? Our body is like a superhero, using the good stuff from food to make us strong, and getting rid of the bad stuff as poop!

Imagine you have a lot of toys, and you want to send some of them to your friend who lives on the other side of a big ocean.

To get your toys to your friend, you need to put them on a big boat. But the boat can't just come onto the land where you are, because it's too big and the water isn't deep enough.

So, you need a special place where the boat can come and pick up your toys. This special place is called a "port".

A port is like a big parking lot for boats. It's where the boats come to pick up and drop off things, like your toys. The port has special equipment, like big cranes, to help lift the toys off the land and onto the boat.

When the boat is loaded with your toys, it can sail across the ocean to another port, where your friend can come and pick up their toys!

So, a port is like a special helper that makes it possible for boats to bring and take things to and from different places. Make sense?

So, you know how we can talk about things that happened a long time ago, like when you were a baby?

And you know how we can talk about things that will happen later, like when you're going to have a birthday party next week?

Well, "present" is like the time that is happening RIGHT NOW! It's like the moment you're sitting here, playing, or eating a snack. It's the time that is happening at this very second!

For example, if I say "I am eating a sandwich," that means I am eating a sandwich RIGHT NOW, in the present. It's not something I ate yesterday, and it's not something I'm going to eat tomorrow. I'm eating it NOW!

Does that make sense?

Let me tell you about a "POLE"!

Imagine you're playing outside and you see a big, long stick standing up straight in the ground. That's a pole!

It's like a big, tall friend that helps us do things. Sometimes it's used to hold up things like a flag, or a streetlight, or even a big tent!

You can also use a pole to help you do fun things, like fishing! You can put a string on the end of a pole and catch fish in the water.

So, a pole is just a long, strong stick that helps us do lots of cool things! Isn't that fun?

A "pool" is a big hole in the ground that's filled with WATER!

Imagine you're playing outside on a hot day, and you're sweating and feeling yucky. You go to a special place where there's a big hole, and it's filled with cool water! You can jump in and splash around, and it makes you feel happy and cool!

Some people have pools in their backyard, so they can swim and play in the water whenever they want. Others go to a special place called a "swimming pool" where lots of people go to swim and have fun.

You can swim, dive, and play games in the pool. It's like a big water playground! And when you're all done, you can get out and dry off with a towel.

Isn't that FUN?

Let me tell you about "porter"!

A long time ago, there were people called "porters". They were like superheroes who helped carry heavy things for other people.

Imagine you're going on a big trip with your family, and you have lots of big suitcases. You can't carry them all by yourself, right? That's where the porter comes in! They're like a strong helper who carries your heavy bags for you.

They would pick up your bags and carry them to the train or the hotel, so you don't have to. It's like having a magic helper who makes your trip easier!

Some people were porters on trains, and they would help carry people's bags from one place to another. They were very strong and kind, and people were very happy to have them help.

That's what a porter is! A friendly helper who carries heavy things for you.

So, you know how we cook food in the kitchen? Like, we make yummy things like soup or pasta?

Well, a "pot" is a big container that we use to cook those yummy things in. It's usually made of metal, like a big bowl with handles on the sides.

We put water or other liquids in the pot, and then we add food like vegetables or meat. Then, we put the pot on the stove, which is like a big machine that makes the pot hot.

When the pot is hot, it helps cook the food inside it. And when it's done, we take it off the stove and... TA-DA! We have a delicious meal!

Does that make sense?

So, you know how sometimes good things happen to you, like getting a yummy ice cream or playing with your favorite toy? And sometimes not-so-good things happen, like getting a boo-boo or having a rainy day when you wanted to play outside?

Well, some people believe that there's a special kind of helper, called God, who is always watching over us and taking care of us. And when good things happen, it's like God is giving us a big hug and saying, "I'm taking care of you, and I want you to be happy!"

That's kind of like what 'providence' means. It's like God's special plan to take care of us and make sure everything works out okay. It's like having a super kind and loving grown-up who is always looking out for us, even when we don't understand what's happening.

For example, imagine you're on a road trip with your family, and you get lost. You might feel scared or worried. But your parents know the way, and they can help you get back on track. That's kind of like what God's providence is - He's like the ultimate parent, guiding us and taking care of us, even when we don't know what's going on.

Does that make sense?

Let's talk about EYES!

You know how we can see things around us? Like toys, and mommy, and daddy? That's because of our eyes!

Inside our eyes, there's a special tiny hole called the "pupil". It's like a little window that lets light come in.

Imagine you're in a dark room, and you want to let some sunlight in. You would open a window, right? The pupil is like that window. It opens and closes to let more or less light into our eyes.

When it's bright outside, the pupil gets smaller, like a tiny window. And when it's dark, it gets bigger, like a bigger window, to let more light in.

Isn't that cool? Our eyes are like special cameras that help us see the world, and the pupil is like a magic window that helps us see better!

So, you know how we can send letters to our friends and family, right? We write something on a piece of paper, put it in an envelope, and give it to a special person called a mailman.

The mailman then takes the letter to a special place called a post office. The post office is like a big house that helps send the letter to the right person.

When we say "post" something, it means we're sending it to someone else, like a letter or a picture. We can post it online, which means we put it on the computer or phone so other people can see it.

For example, if you draw a picture and want your grandma to see it, you can post it online, and she can look at it on her computer or phone, even if she's far, far away!

Does that make sense?

Let me tell you about RAFTS!

Imagine you're playing at the beach or a pool, and you want to go swimming in the water. But, you don't want to swim all by yourself, or you might get tired. So, you need something to help you stay on top of the water.

That's where a RAFT comes in! A raft is like a big, flat, floating bed that you can sit or lie on. It's usually made of special material that doesn't sink, like rubber or plastic.

You can climb onto the raft, and it will help you stay on top of the water. You can relax, play, or even read a book on the raft! It's like having a special floating friend that keeps you safe and happy in the water.

Some rafts are big and can fit lots of people, and some are small, just for one or two friends. But they all help you have fun in the water!

Does that make sense? Do you want to go play on a raft now?

Oh boy, are you going to love learning about "rake"!

So, you know how sometimes we play outside and there's leaves on the ground? And it can be hard to walk or play because there are so many leaves?

Well, "rake" is a special tool that grown-ups use to pick up those leaves and make the ground clean again!

It's like a big comb for leaves! You hold the handle and use the rake to sweep the leaves into a pile. Then, you can pick up the leaves and throw them away or put them in a special bag.

Some people also use rakes to make the dirt look nice and neat in their gardens. They use it to smooth out the dirt and make it look pretty.

So, "rake" is like a magic tool that helps us clean up outside and make it look nice and pretty!

And, guess what? "Rake" is also a secret code word that some grown-ups use when they're working on big projects. They say "rake" and it means "do a special task"! But that's a grown-up thing, and you don't need to worry about that right now. Just remember, rake is a cool tool for cleaning up leaves!

So, you know how there are lots of different people in the world, right? And they all look a little different from each other?

Some people have skin that's really light, like a piece of paper. Some people have skin that's really dark, like chocolate. And some people have skin that's somewhere in between.

A long time ago, people thought that just because someone's skin was a different color, they were a different kind of person. They called these different kinds of people different "races".

But, the thing is, we're all humans! We all have the same kind of body, and we all need the same things to survive, like food and water and love.

The differences in our skin color and hair and eyes are just because our ancestors came from different parts of the world, and their bodies adapted to the sun and the weather and the food they ate there.

So, "race" is just a word that people used to try to group us into different categories, but it's not really a real thing. We're all just people, and we're all the same on the inside!

Does that make sense?

Ooh, let me tell you about "repair"!

So, you know how sometimes things get broken, like your favorite toy or a chair?

"Repair" means fixing those broken things so they work properly again!

Imagine you have a toy car with a broken wheel. You can't play with it because it's not rolling around like it's supposed to. But, if someone fixes the wheel, like glues it back on or replaces it with a new one, then your toy car will work again!

That's "repair"! It's like giving something a big hug and making it all better so you can use it again.

Does that make sense?

So, you know how sometimes you run around and play outside and have so much fun? And then you get a little tired?

"Rest" is when you stop running around and playing, and you sit or lie down and relax. It's like giving your body a big hug and saying, "Okay, I'm tired. I need a break."

When you rest, your body gets to fix itself a little bit, and you feel happy and calm again. It's like recharging a toy that needs batteries - your body is like a toy that needs rest to keep going!

You can rest in lots of ways, like:

* Taking a nap
* Sitting on the couch and reading a book
* Lying down on your bed and listening to a story
* Even just sitting quietly and watching the clouds outside!

Resting is important because it helps you feel better and have more energy to play again! Does that make sense?

So, you know how we can talk to our friends and family on the phone? Like, you can call Grandma and say "Hi, Grandma!"?

Well, when you call someone, their phone makes a special sound to let them know that someone is calling them. That sound is called a "ring".

It's like a little "ding-ding-ding" or "ring-ring-ring" that the phone makes to say, "Hey, someone is calling you! Pick up the phone and talk to them!"

So, when you hear that sound, it means someone is trying to talk to the person who's phone is ringing!

So, you know how sometimes animals like deer and elk roam around and do their own thing? Well, when it's a certain time of year, some male animals like deer and elk get a little... excited. They start to feel like they need to find a friend to be with, and they get a bit grumpy if they don't.

This is called being "in rut". It's like when you're playing with your friends and you really want to be the boss, and you might get a bit upset if someone else tries to be the boss too. The male animals feel like they need to be the boss and find a friend, so they might stomp their feet, make loud noises, or even fight with other males.

It's a natural part of being an animal, and it helps them make babies. But it can also be a bit scary for people who are around them, because they might get a bit too grumpy or loud. So, we need to be careful and respectful when we're around animals that are in rut.

Does that make sense?

Oh boy, are you going to love learning about sage!

Sage is a type of plant that grows in the ground. It's like a little green friend that smells really good! When you touch its leaves, they feel a bit fuzzy.

Some people use sage to make yummy food taste even better. It's like a special seasoning that you can sprinkle on things like stuffing, roasted chicken, or even soup.

But that's not all! Sage is also very good for you. It can help keep you healthy and make you feel better when you're not feeling well.

And guess what? Sage is also a very smart name! Some people are called "sage" because they're very wise and know a lot of things. It's like they're super smart and can help others.

So, that's what sage is! It's a yummy plant, a helpful seasoning, and even a cool name for someone who's really smart. Isn't that awesome?

Let's talk about "row"!

Imagine you have some toy cars, and you want to put them in a line on the floor. You put one car next to the other, like friends holding hands.

A "row" is when you put things, like toy cars, or blocks, or even people, in a straight line, one next to the other.

For example, if you have 5 toy cars, and you put them in a line like this:

 Car 1, Car 2, Car 3, Car 4, Car 5

That's a "row" of toy cars! You can make a row with anything you like, and it's just a fancy way of saying "things in a straight line".

Does that make sense?

Oh boy, are you going to love this!

A "sash" is a special kind of belt or ribbon that you wear around your waist. It's like a big, pretty strap that goes around your tummy!

Imagine you're wearing a superhero costume, and you need something to hold up your superhero pants. That's what a sash can do! It can also be a fancy decoration that makes you look super cool and special.

Some people wear sashes for fun, like at a costume party or a special event. Others wear them as part of a traditional outfit, like a kimono in Japan.

So, a sash is like a big, colorful hug for your waist!

Let me tell you about a "saw"!

A saw is a special tool that helps us cut things. You know, like when you want to make a piece of wood smaller or into a different shape.

Imagine you have a big piece of cookie dough, and you want to make it into smaller cookies. You would use a special tool to cut it, right?

A saw is like that tool, but for wood! It's like a big, sharp toothy friend that helps us cut through wood. We move it back and forth, and it makes a "zzzip" sound as it cuts.

There are different kinds of saws, like a big one for grown-ups to use, or a little one for kids to play with (but only with a grown-up's help!).

So, that's what a saw is! It's a helpful tool that makes cutting wood easy and fun!

Oh boy, let me tell you about "scrub"!

"Scrub" is a fun word that means to CLEAN something really well!

Imagine you have a toy that's all dirty and yucky. You can take a special sponge or cloth and some soap, and RUB it all over the toy to make it clean again. That's called "scrubbing"!

It's like giving the toy a big hug with soap and water to make it squeaky clean!

You can scrub lots of things, like your hands, your toys, or even the floor! It's like a special way to make everything clean and shiny.

Does that make sense? Do you want to go scrub something now?

Ooh, let me tell you about "scrap"!

So, you know how we use things like paper, metal, and plastic to make lots of cool stuff like toys, cars, and buildings? Well, sometimes those things get broken or old, and we don't need them anymore.

"Scrap" is what we call those old or broken things that we don't need anymore. It's like when you draw on a piece of paper and then you don't want it anymore, so you throw it away. That paper is like scrap!

But, the good news is that some of that scrap can be used again! We can recycle it, which means we can make new things from the old things. It's like giving old things a new life!

For example, old cans can be melted down and made into new cans or even into new toys! Isn't that cool?

So, "scrap" is like a big pile of old things that we can reuse or recycle to make new and exciting things!

Oh boy, are you going to learn something new today!

"Sept" is a special word that comes from a long time ago. It's a part of some big words that grown-ups use.

"Sept" means "seven". Isn't that cool? It's like a secret code that tells you that the word has something to do with the number 7!

For example, "September" is a month in the calendar, and it has "sept" in it. That's because it used to be the 7th month a long, long time ago!

So, whenever you see "sept" in a word, you can think of the number 7!

So, you know how we use the toilet to go pee and poo? And then we flush it away?

Well, when we flush it, it goes into a special pipe under the ground. And that pipe is connected to a really big pipe, called a sewer.

The sewer is like a big tunnel that carries all the yucky stuff away from our houses and into a special place where it gets cleaned. It's like a magic pipe that makes the bad stuff go away!

The people who take care of the sewer are like superheroes, making sure it's working properly so we don't get any stinky problems. And they wear special suits to keep them safe while they're working down there.

So, the sewer is like a helpful friend that takes care of the yucky stuff, and makes sure our town stays clean and healthy!

Oh boy, are you going to love this!

Imagine you have a toy car, and it's really small. Now, imagine you have a real car, and it's really big! The "scale" is like a special number that tells us how much bigger or smaller something is compared to the real thing.

Let's say your toy car is 1 inch long, and the real car is 10 feet long. That means the real car is much, much bigger than your toy car! The scale would tell us how many times bigger the real car is compared to the toy car.

For example, if the scale is 1:10, it means that 1 inch on the toy car is equal to 10 inches on the real car. So, if you make the toy car bigger or smaller, the scale will tell you how big or small it is compared to the real car.

It's like a secret code that helps us understand how things are related in size! Does that make sense?

Let me tell you about SOIL!

Soil is the brown stuff that you see on the ground outside. It's like a special blanket that covers the Earth.

You know how plants grow in the ground? Like flowers and trees? Well, soil is what helps them grow. It's like food for plants!

Soil is made up of tiny bits of rocks, and old leaves, and tiny living things that are too small to see. It's like a big mix of everything!

When you dig in the dirt, you're playing with soil! And when you plant a seed in the soil, it helps the seed grow into a big, strong plant.

Soil is also home to lots of little creatures like worms and bugs. They live in the soil and help make it healthy.

So, soil is like a special helper that makes plants grow, and it's fun to play in too!

Let me tell you about SLUGS!

A slug is a kind of animal that lives in the ground and on plants. It's like a big, slimy worm, but it's not a worm! 

Slugs are soft and squishy, and they don't have any legs. They move really slowly, like they're sliding on the ground. They leave behind a trail of yucky, slimy stuff that helps them move around.

Slugs like to eat plants, like leaves and flowers. They can be a little bit naughty and eat the plants in our gardens!

Some people don't like slugs because they can be a bit messy, but they're actually really cool creatures. And they help to break down old plants and make the soil healthy.

Want to know a fun fact? Slugs are related to snails! Snails have shells, but slugs don't. Isn't that cool?

A "spade" is a special tool that grown-ups use to dig in the ground!

Imagine you're playing in a sandbox, and you want to make a big hole. You can use a special shovel called a "spade" to scoop up the sand and make a hole.

A spade is like a big, strong hand that helps you dig. It has a flat part that you push into the ground, and a handle that you hold onto. When you push the spade into the ground, it helps to break up the dirt and make a hole.

Grown-ups use spades to plant flowers, dig holes for trees, and even to make gardens! Isn't that cool?

Let me tell you about "SPELL"!

So, you know how we can talk and say words, like "cat" or "dog"? Well, when we "spell" a word, it means we say the letters that make up that word, one by one.

For example, if I want to spell "cat", I would say: "C... A... T". See? I'm saying the letters that make up the word "cat".

It's like a secret code! We use letters to make words, and when we spell a word, we're using the code to say the word, letter by letter.

Does that make sense? Do you want to try spelling a word with me?

Oh boy, are you going to love this!

Imagine you have a bunch of toys, like blocks, dolls, and cars, all mixed together on the floor.

Now, imagine you want to pick up just the toy cars. You can use your hands to grab them, one by one. But, what if you want to pick up a few toy cars that are next to each other? You can use your hands to scoop them up together!

In computers, we have something called "text" (like words on a screen). And just like your toy cars, we might want to do something special with some of those words that are next to each other.

That's where "span" comes in! It's like a magic hand that can grab a few words that are next to each other, so we can do something special with them. We can make them look different, or behave differently, just by wrapping our magic "span" around them.

For example, if we have the words "I love ice cream", we can use "span" to grab just the words "ice cream" and make them look bigger or bolder, so they stand out!

So, "span" is like a special helper that lets us pick out a few words that are together, and do something fun with them!

Oh boy, are you going to learn something new today!

So, you know how sometimes you're playing and you run really fast, and then your feet go "whoops!" and you fall down? That's because your feet slipped on the ground!

"Slip" means when something is moving, like your feet, and it suddenly goes in a different direction because it's not sticking to the ground or surface it's on. It's like when you're on a slide and you go "Wheeee!" and you slide down really fast. Your bottom is slipping on the slide!

It can happen with other things too, like when you're holding a toy and it slips out of your hands. Or when you're on a slippery floor and you slip and fall.

So, "slip" is when something moves in a way it wasn't supposed to, and it can be a little bit surprising and sometimes funny!

Let me tell you about SOUND!

You know how sometimes you clap your hands or bang a drum? And then you hear a "CLAP" or a "BOOM"? That's SOUND!

Sound is like a special kind of message that travels through the air. When you make a noise, like clapping or banging, it makes the air around you move. The air moves in a special way, like a wave, and that wave goes to your ears.

Your ears are like special listeners that hear the wave and say, "Oh, I know what that is! That's a CLAP!" or "That's a BOOM!" And then you hear the sound!

It's like when you throw a stone into a pond and it makes ripples in the water. Sound is like ripples in the air that your ears can feel and understand.

Isn't that cool? Do you want to make some sound now and see if you can hear it?

Oh boy, let me explain "stake" to you in a super fun way!

Imagine you have a lemonade stand, and you want to make sure nobody takes it away from you. So, you put a special stick in the ground near your stand, and you tie a sign to it that says "My Lemonade Stand!" 

That stick is like a "stake"! It's like saying, "Hey, this is mine! I own this lemonade stand, and I'm claiming it as my own!"

When grown-ups talk about a "stake" in something, they mean they have a special interest or ownership in it, just like you have a stake in your lemonade stand. It means they care about it a lot and want to make sure it's safe and successful!

Does that make sense?

Let me tell you about "swede"!

A swede is a type of yummy root vegetable! It's like a big, round, orange or yellow ball that grows underground. Some people call it a "swedish turnip" because it's a bit like a turnip, but it's sweeter and tastes a bit different.

When you cook a swede, it gets all soft and yummy, and it's great to eat with some butter or as part of a special meal. Some people like to mash it up like mashed potatoes, and that's really tasty too!

So, that's what a swede is! It's a delicious, underground treat that's good to eat. Do you want to try some?

Oh boy, are you going to love learning about "tab"!

So, you know how we can type on a keyboard, right? Like, you can type your name or your favorite word?

Well, on a keyboard, there's a special button called "Tab". It's like a magic button that helps us move to the next thing we want to type.

Imagine you're playing a game where you have to fill in some blanks, like your name, age, and favorite color. When you type your name and press "Tab", it will take you to the next blank, so you can type your age. And when you press "Tab" again, it will take you to the next blank, so you can type your favorite color!

It's like a little helper that makes it easy to move around and type things in the right places. And that's what "Tab" does!

Does that make sense?

Imagine you have lots of toys, and you want to take them to your friend's house. But, it's hard to carry all the toys one by one. So, you put all your toys into a big box. Now, it's easy to carry the box with all your toys inside.

"Tar" is like a magic box for computers. It helps put lots of files (like your toys) into one big file (like the box). This makes it easy to move or send many files together.

Just like how you can open the box and play with your toys again, "tar" helps computers put the files back into their original form, so you can use them again.

Isn't that cool?

Oh boy, let me explain "strain" to you in a super fun way!

Imagine you have a big rubber band. You can stretch it and make it longer, right? When you stretch it, it gets a bit tight and might even hurt a little bit if you stretch it too much.

"Strain" is like what happens to the rubber band when you stretch it too much. It's when something gets hurt or feels yucky because it's being pulled or stretched too hard.

For example, if you lift a really heavy toy, you might feel a strain in your arm. It's like your arm is saying, "Ow, I'm tired! That's too heavy for me!"

Or, if you play outside and run around too much, you might feel a strain in your legs. It's like your legs are saying, "Whoa, slow down! I'm tired from all that running!"

So, "strain" is like a little ouchie that happens when something gets too tired or stretched too much. Make sense?

Oh boy, are you ready for a fun explanation?

A "tick" is a tiny bug that lives outside. It's like a little tiny spider, but it's not a spider. Ticks are very small, so you need to look closely to see them.

Imagine you're playing outside in the woods or in a park, and you're running around in the grass. Sometimes, a tick might be hiding in the grass, and it might crawl onto your skin. That's when it can be a problem.

Ticks like to drink the blood of animals, like dogs and sometimes even people! But they don't hurt us on purpose. They just like to drink our blood to survive.

The good news is that grown-ups can help keep you safe from ticks. We can wear special clothes, like long sleeves and pants, and use special spray to keep them away. And if a tick does crawl onto you, a grown-up can help remove it.

So, that's what a tick is! It's a tiny bug that lives outside, and we need to be careful around it. But don't worry, we're here to keep you safe!

So, you know how sometimes you go on a road trip with your family, and you drive on a special road that's really nice and smooth?

Well, some of those roads are called "tolls". And when you drive on a toll road, you have to pay a little bit of money to use it. It's like a fee to drive on that road.

Imagine you're going to a fun playground, and you have to pay a small amount of money to get in. That's kind of like a toll! You pay the money, and then you get to use the road or go to the playground.

The money you pay is called a "toll", and it helps to keep the road nice and safe for everyone to drive on. Some people pay the toll at a special booth, and others might have a special card or device in their car that pays the toll automatically.

Does that make sense?

So, when you go to a restaurant with your family, there are people who help you, right? Like, the person who takes your order, and the person who brings you your food.

Those people are called "waiters" or "waitresses". They work hard to make sure you have yummy food and a nice time.

A "tip" is like a special thank-you gift for them. It's a little bit of extra money that you give them to say "thank you for helping me!"

It's like when you give a big hug to someone you love. A tip is like a big hug for the waiter or waitress, but with money.

Grown-ups usually give tips when they eat at a restaurant, and it's a way to show that they appreciate the person's help. Does that make sense?

So, you know how we have roads that cars drive on, right? Like, big roads that go to different places?

Well, a "tract" is kind of like a big road, but it's not for cars. It's for land! A tract is a big piece of land that is all connected together.

Imagine you have a big piece of playdough, and you cut out a square or a rectangle shape. That's kind of like a tract of land! It's a big area of land that is all together.

Sometimes, people buy or own a tract of land to build houses, or to grow crops, or to have a park. It's like having a big playground, but instead of swings and slides, it's a big area of land!

Does that make sense?

Oh boy, are you going to love this!

So, you know how sometimes you draw a picture? Like, you take a pencil and you make a picture on a piece of paper?

Well, "trace" is when you take a piece of paper that already has a picture on it, and you put another piece of paper on top of it. Then, you use a pencil to draw the same picture again, but this time on the new piece of paper.

You're not drawing a new picture, you're just copying the one that's underneath. You're "tracing" it!

It's like magic! You get to make a copy of the picture without having to draw it all by yourself.

Does that make sense? Do you want to try tracing something?

Let me tell you about TURKEYS!

A turkey is a big bird! It's like a chicken, but bigger. They have feathers, and they can run around and make lots of noise.

Turkeys are special because they have yummy meat that people like to eat. Some people eat turkey on a special day called Thanksgiving. It's like a big party where people come together and eat a big meal.

Turkeys also have really cool feathers. They can be brown, or white, or even have shiny colors like bronze. Some turkeys have a big, fluffy tail that they can spread out like a fan.

And guess what? Turkeys can make funny sounds! They go "Gobble! Gobble!" It's like they're saying, "Hello! I'm a turkey!"

Isn't that cool? Do you like turkeys?

So, you know how we take care of our bodies when we're sick or hurt? Like, we go see a doctor?

Well, animals like dogs and cats and even horses get sick or hurt too! And they need someone to take care of them.

A "vet" is like a doctor for animals! They help make the animals feel better when they're sick or hurt. They give them medicine, fix their boo-boos, and make sure they're healthy and happy.

Just like how you go to the doctor to get better, animals go to the vet to get better too! Isn't that cool?

Oh boy, are you going to love learning about "wattle"!

So, you know how we have fences around our houses or gardens to keep things safe? Well, a long time ago, people used to make fences out of sticks and branches. They would weave them together, like a big basket, to make a strong wall.

This way of making a fence is called "wattle". It's like a big, strong basket made out of sticks! People would use thin branches, like the ones from trees, and weave them together to make a wall. Sometimes, they would even put mud or clay in between the sticks to make it stronger.

A long time ago, people used wattle to build their homes, too! They would make a big wattle wall, and then put a roof on top. It was like a cozy little house made out of sticks!

Isn't that cool? Wattle is like a special way of building things using sticks and branches. And it's still used today, in some places, to make beautiful and strong fences and walls!

Let me tell you about "Washington"!

So, you know how we live in a country called the United States of America? Well, "Washington" is a very special place in that country.

There are actually two "Washingtons" that are important:

1. **Washington, D.C.**: This is a big city where the people who make big decisions for our country work. It's like a big office building, but instead of offices, it's where the President and other important people live and work. It's like the "headquarters" of our country!
2. **The state of Washington**: This is a place on the west coast of America, where lots of people live and have fun. It's got mountains, forests, and oceans, and it's a great place to play outside!

And then there's **George Washington**, who was a very important person a long time ago. He was like a superhero, but instead of having superpowers, he was a brave leader who helped our country become free. He's often called the "Father of Our Country" because he was one of the first leaders of America!

So, that's "Washington" in a nutshell! It's a special city, a state, and a person who was very important to our country's history.

Let me tell you about a "yard"!

A yard is a big open space outside a house or a building. It's like a big playground! You can play, run around, and have lots of fun in a yard.

Imagine you're outside your house, and you can see grass, maybe some flowers, and some trees. That's your yard! You can play tag with your friends, ride your bike, or just sit and enjoy the fresh air.

Some yards have swings, slides, and other fun things to play on. Some yards are big, and some are small. But they're all special because they're outside, and you can have so much fun there!

Does that make sense? Do you have a yard where you live?

So, you know how we live in a special place with our family and friends? Well, "America" is a big country where lots of people live, just like us!

Imagine a really, really big playground with lots of different things to see and do. That's kind of like America! It's a country with lots of different states, like big sections in the playground. Some states have mountains, some have beaches, and some have big cities with tall buildings.

Lots of people from different families live in America, and they all speak a language called English (that's the language we speak!). They eat yummy food, play games, and have fun just like we do!

America is also a country with a special flag that has stars and stripes on it. People like to sing a special song called the "National Anthem" when they see the flag.

So, America is like a big, happy family with lots of people, places, and things to enjoy!

Let's talk about "Mississippi"!

"Mississippi" is a big word that is actually the name of a state in the United States of America. It's a place where people live, and it's very special.

Imagine you're on a big adventure, and you're going to a place with lots of water, like rivers and lakes. That's kind of what Mississippi is like! It's got lots of water, and it's also got lots of yummy food like gumbo and fried catfish.

The word "Mississippi" is also fun to say because it has a lot of "S"s and "I"s in it. Try saying it with me: "Miss-is-sip-pi". Isn't that fun?

So, "Mississippi" is a special place with lots of water and yummy food, and it's a fun word to say!

Ireland is a COOL place!

Imagine a big island, surrounded by water, with lots of green grass and pretty rocks. That's Ireland!

There are lots of friendly people living there, and they like to play, sing, and dance. They have a special kind of music that makes you want to move your feet!

Ireland is also home to lots of cute animals, like sheep and cows, and even some magical creatures like leprechauns (but they're just pretend, wink-wink!).

The people in Ireland love to eat yummy food like potatoes, fish, and a special kind of bread called "soda bread". And they drink a lot of tea!

Some really cool things about Ireland are:

* The cliffs are super tall and go "WHOOSH!" down to the ocean!
* There are lots of castles, like fairy tale castles!
* The people in Ireland are very friendly and love to say "Cad Mle Filte" (that's "a hundred thousand welcomes"!)

So, that's Ireland in a nutshell! Isn't it a great place?

Oh boy, are you going to love learning about "tidewater"!

So, you know how we have oceans and seas, right? And sometimes the water comes up onto the beach, and sometimes it goes back out? That's because of something called "tides".

Tides are like big waves that happen every day, and they make the water level go up and down. When the water comes up onto the beach, it's called "high tide". And when it goes back out, it's called "low tide".

Now, "tidewater" is a special kind of water that is affected by these tides. It's the water that is near the ocean, like in bays, estuaries, and rivers that connect to the ocean.

Imagine you're playing near a river that flows into the ocean. When the tide is high, the water in the river might come up and cover some of the beach or the riverbank. And when the tide is low, the water might go back out and expose some of the riverbed or mudflats.

That's tidewater! It's the water that is influenced by the ocean's tides, and it can be really cool to explore and play in.

Does that make sense?

A village is a place where people live in houses, and there are not too many houses. It's like a small neighborhood!

Imagine you're playing with your friends in a big open space, and there are some houses around you. You can see fields or farms nearby where animals like cows and chickens live. There might be a small shop or a park where you can play.

A village is like a little community where people know each other, and they help each other out. It's a nice and cozy place to live!

Does that make sense?

"Atlanta" is a big word that is the name of a city!

Imagine you're playing with your friends in a big playground. Atlanta is like a REALLY BIG playground, but instead of swings and slides, it's got lots of buildings, roads, and people!

It's a special place where lots of people live, work, and have fun together. There are big buildings, like skyscrapers, and lots of cars and buses driving around. You can even visit a big park called Piedmont Park, where you can play on the swings and slides, just like in your own playground!

Atlanta is also a very important city, kind of like a big hub. It's where lots of people come to visit, work, and have fun. And, it's where the Braves (a baseball team) and the Falcons (a football team) play their games!

So, that's Atlanta in a nutshell! It's a big, fun city with lots of exciting things to see and do!

So, you know how sometimes you want to do things by yourself, like dress yourself or play with your toys without help? That's kind of like being independent.

Being independent means being able to do things on your own, without needing someone else to help you. It's like being a big kid!

Imagine you're playing with blocks, and you want to build a really tall tower. If you're independent, you can do it all by yourself, without needing Mom or Dad to help you. You can pick up the blocks, stack them up, and make the tower all on your own!

Being independent is a good thing because it makes you feel proud of yourself and happy that you can do things by yourself. And, it also helps you learn new things and become a super cool, big kid!

Let me tell you about ROME!

A long, long time ago, there was a special city called Rome. It was in a country called Italy, which is in Europe.

Imagine you're playing with your friends in a big playground. Rome was like a really, really big playground, but instead of swings and slides, it had BIG buildings, roads, and lots of people!

A long time ago, Rome was the capital city of a big group of people called the Romans. They were like a big team, and they worked together to build amazing things like:

* Big roads that went all the way to other cities
* A huge building called the Colosseum where they had fun events like gladiator battles (don't worry, it was a long time ago, and nobody gets hurt now!)
* Temples where they went to say hello to their gods
* A big market where they bought yummy food and other cool things

The Romans were very good at building things, and they made Rome a really cool place to live. They even had a special system to bring clean water to their homes!

But, a long time ago, the Romans started to have some problems, and eventually, their big team didn't work together as well as it used to. That's when other groups of people started to come and visit Rome, and sometimes, they even took over!

Even though Rome isn't as powerful as it used to be, it's still a very special city today. People from all around the world visit Rome to see the old buildings, eat yummy Italian food, and learn about its rich history!

Isn't that cool? Do you want to be an explorer and visit Rome one day?

NEW YORK IS SO MUCH FUN!

New York is a BIG CITY! It's like a really, really big playground with lots of people, buildings, and things to see and do!

Imagine a place with:

* REALLY TALL BUILDINGS that touch the sky!
* CARS and TRUCKS and BUSES that go "VROOOM!" on the roads!
* PEOPLE from all around the world, speaking different languages and wearing different clothes!
* YUMMY FOOD, like pizza, hot dogs, and bagels!
* PARKS and PLAYGROUNDS where you can play on swings and slides!
* A BIG STATUE OF A LADY (called the Statue of Liberty) who says "Hello!" to everyone!

And, guess what? There's a special place called TIMES SQUARE where there are BIG, BRIGHT LIGHTS and LOUD MUSIC and it's like a big party!

New York is also where you can find:

* A really cool place called CENTRAL PARK where you can ride a bike or have a picnic!
* A big, famous THEATER where people perform magic shows and plays!
* A special place called THE BRONX where you can see REAL DINOSAUR BONES!

Wow, right? New York is like a big, exciting adventure! Who wants to go there?

Let me tell you about Birmingham!

Birmingham is a big city in a country called England. It's like a really, really big town with lots of houses, shops, and roads.

Imagine you're playing with your friends in a big playground. Birmingham is like that playground, but instead of swings and slides, it has big buildings, cars, and buses.

Lots of people live in Birmingham, and they all do different things like go to school, work in shops, or play in parks. There's even a big canal (like a really long, narrow lake) that boats can sail on!

Some people like to visit Birmingham because it has lots of fun things to do, like:

* Going to a big museum to see old things like dinosaurs and treasure
* Eating yummy food from different countries, like Indian curries or Italian pizza
* Watching sports, like football (that's soccer!) at a big stadium
* Playing in big parks with swings and slides, just like your playground!

Birmingham is a special place where lots of people live, work, and have fun together!

Isn't that cool?

Oh boy, are you going to love this!

"Red" is a COLOR! You know, like the things you see around you? Like apples, fire trucks, and roses?

Imagine you're eating a juicy, ripe apple. The apple is RED! It's a bright, happy color that makes you feel excited.

Or, think about a big, loud fire truck driving down the street. It's RED too! The color red is like a big shout that says, "Hey, look at me! I'm important!"

So, "red" is a special color that makes things stand out and look super cool! Do you like the color red?

Oh boy, are you ready for a cool fact?

So, you know how we live on the Earth, right? And the Earth is like a big ball.

Well, the Earth is made up of different layers, like a big onion!

The outside layer is the crust, where we live and walk around. It's like the skin of the Earth.

Underneath the crust, there's a really, really hot layer called the mantle. It's like a big, gooey blanket that surrounds the Earth's core.

Imagine you're holding a big jar of honey, and you tilt it. The honey moves slowly, right? That's kind of like what the mantle is like. It's a thick, slow-moving layer that can take a long time to change.

The mantle is important because it helps move the Earth's crust around, which can create mountains and volcanoes. It's like a big, underground helper that shapes our planet!

Isn't that cool?

Let me tell you about MASSACHUSETTS!

So, you know how we live in a big country called the United States? Well, Massachusetts is one of the states in that country!

It's a special place on the East Coast, which means it's near the ocean. You can go to the beach there and play in the sand!

A long time ago, Massachusetts was one of the first places that people from England came to live in America. They sailed on big boats called ships, and it was a very important place for our country's history.

There are lots of cool things to see and do in Massachusetts, like:

* Visiting the city of Boston, where you can see the Freedom Trail and learn about history
* Going to the beach in places like Cape Cod
* Eating yummy things like clam chowder and Boston cream pie (yum!)
* Visiting the homes of famous people, like where the Pilgrims lived

Massachusetts is a fun place to visit, and lots of people love living there too!

Does that make sense? Do you have any questions about Massachusetts?

Let's talk about MISSOURI!

Missouri is a STATE! You know how we live in a country called the United States of America? Well, Missouri is one of the 50 special places that make up that country!

Imagine the United States is a big puzzle, and Missouri is one of the puzzle pieces. It's located in the middle of the country, kind of like the heart!

Missouri is a really cool place with lots of fun things to see and do. There are big rivers, like the Mississippi River, that boats can sail on. There are also lots of hills and caves to explore!

Some people like to visit Missouri because it's home to some really famous things, like:

* The Gateway Arch: a big, shiny arch that looks like a giant metal rainbow!
* Kansas City: a city that's famous for its yummy BBQ (that's barbecue, or grilled meat!) and awesome jazz music!
* Mark Twain's hometown: a place where a famous writer lived, and you can still visit his house today!

Missouri is also a great place to learn about history, because it's where some really important things happened a long time ago.

So, that's Missouri in a nutshell! It's a fun state with lots to see, do, and learn about. Who knows, maybe one day you'll get to visit!

Let me tell you about "Great Britain"!

So, you know how we live in a special place called a country? Well, Great Britain is a big island that has three countries on it!

The three countries are:

1. **England** (where some people like to eat fish and chips!)
2. **Scotland** (where some people wear special kilts and play bagpipes!)
3. **Wales** (where some people love to sing and have lots of sheep!)

All these countries are together on the same big island, and that's called Great Britain! It's like a big team, working together.

Imagine you're playing with your friends, and you're all on the same playground. That's kind of like Great Britain - England, Scotland, and Wales are all friends, playing together on the same island!

Isn't that cool?
